results.title: My first science video
results.brief_description: An introduction to the world of science with fifteen simple experiments using everyday materials from around the world. Some of the experiments include making a volcano, making games using magnets and simple electrical and kitchen chemistry experiments.

results.title: My first nature video
results.brief_description: A guide to nature projects for children to do in and around the home. Some of the nature projects include how to grow and plant seeds, making bird feeders, insect pit traps and growing a garden in a bottle.

results.title: My first music video
results.brief_description: Shows how to make simple musical instruments from everyday materials using step by step instructions. Includes shakers, tambourines, drums, bells, xylophone, triangle, pan pipes, banjo and harp.

results.title: My first magic video
results.brief_description: A dazzling array of tricks for children aged 5 to 9 to prepare and perform at home. A professional magican explains the secrets, in step-by-step detail, shows how to make the props and deliver the “patter” to create a spectacular magic show. Tricks shown include: Magic Scarf, Magic Wand, Spotted Tie Trick, Conjurers Cone, Vanishing Silks, Colour Change Silks, Dancing Matchbox, Levitating Genie, Baffling Bunny Box, Ring and Rope, Ribbon Fountain Finale.
results.description: A dazzling array of tricks for children aged 5 to 9 to prepare and perform at home. results.title: My first green video
results.brief_description: Shows simple experiments and projects that highlight environmental problems. Includes air and water pollution tests, recycling rubbish, growing a wildlife garden, planting a tree and the importance of the rainforest.

results.title: My first cookery video
results.brief_description: An introduction to cooking designed for young children, with fifteen recipes to make. The recipes range from making bread into animals, potatoes into boats to decorating pizzas and making pictures, and fruit fools with funny faces.

results.title: My first alphabet
results.creator_credit: Debney Park Secondary College, Gene Geoffrey, Colin Read and Jenny Cocks
results.brief_description: A colourful and engaging animated alphabet with an Oz flavour to it suitable for young children between the ages 3 to 6. The claymation characters were created and designed by all the students from Year 8/9 Art and Design, Debney Park Secondary College.

results.title: My financial career
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Colin Low and Gerald Potterton
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon film from Stephen Leacock’s witty account of a young man’s first brush with banking. When he goes to make his deposit he is so overawed by the institution that nothing he intends to say comes out right. (Awards: Oscar nomination, Hollywood; San Francisco; New York)
